title: CORRECTED-Shareholders of Australia's Havilah Resources vote against $70 mln investment
text:
CORRECTED-Shareholders of Australia's Havilah Resources vote against $70 mln investment

Commodities 1 hour ago (Sep 14, 2019 10:48)

CORRECTED-Shareholders of Australia's Havilah Resources vote against $70 mln investment (Corrects lede to say the resolution failed to pass, not majority of shareholders voted against it) Sept 12 (Reuters) - Copper-gold explorer Havilah Resources Ltd on Thursday said a resolution regarding a proposed A$100 million ($69 million) investment by GFG Alliance member OneSteel Manufacturing Pty Ltd was not passed. In May, privately-held industrial conglomerate GFG Alliance said it would spend up to A$100 million to get a controlling interest in Havilah to provide materials for its Australian and steel business. its annual general meeting, the company said it received 109.1 million proxy votes against the resolution, while 33.4 million proxy votes were cast in favour. Havilah had said the funding from GFG Alliance member OneSteel Manufacturing Pty Ltd was intended for work programmes on its iron ore assets and copper prospects in the Mutooroo Copper-Cobalt District of New South Wales.

CORRECTED-Shareholders of Australia's Havilah Resources vote against $70 mln investment
description: CORRECTED-Shareholders of Australia's Havilah Resources vote against $70 mln investment
